name: Lower matching number for the n X n torus grid graph.
comment: Seems to be either A008810(n) = ceil(n^2/3) or A008810(n)+1.
For known terms, a(n) is one more than A008810(n) for n = 11, 13, 14, 16.

formula: a(n) = n^2/3 if 3|n, otherwise a(n) >= A008810(n). [Proof: let the [minimum] maximal independent edge set be E. Let b be the number of edges between two vertices incident to different edges from E. The total number of edges connecting a vertex incident to an edge from E and a vertex not incident to any edge from E is equal to 4(n^2-2a(n)) but also to 6a(n)-2b; equalising these, we find b = 7a(n)-2n^2. Also, a(n) <= b, which gives the desired inequality a(n) >= n^2/3.] - _Andrey Zabolotskiy_, Dec 19 2024

name: Minimum number of dominoes on an n X n chessboard needed to prevent placement of another domino.
comment: Each domino must cover exactly two adjacent squares of a row or column. Sequence inspired by question for 8 X 8 case in "Minimum Guard Problem" link.
A.k.a. lower matching number of the n X n grid graph. - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Dec 16 2024
a(n) = 0 for n = 1, a(n) = ceiling(n^2/3) + 1 for n = 19, 22, 23, 25, 26, 28, 29, 31, 32, and a(n) = ceiling(n^2/3) for other n <= 32. - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Dec 16 2024
